results.title: Metamorphosis of the cello
results.brief_description: When a sensitive and accomplished musician plays on such a beautiful instrument as this cello, there comes into being a creation of beauty - music whose power stirs our emotions. what causes this effect - the composer, performer or craftsman who made the instrument? This portrait if the cellist and the history of the cello itself corresponds with the different movements of the music played.

results.title: Metal of the centuries
results.brief_description: Documentary showing the uses of coper, brass, and bronze throughout history and across continents and the processing of copper from ore to its various finished forms such as copper alloys. Also shows the various industries that used the metal such as brewing and the motor and shipping industries.

results.title: Messieurs les Ronds de Cuir = The Pencil Pushers (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
This adaptation of Courteline revolves around a group of public servants working in a Ministry. Boring routine, mental inflexibility, narrowmindness: all the low points of human nature in general, and public administration in particular are being finely observed and satirised.

Credits: Director, writer, Daniel Ceccaldi ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Raymond Pellegrin, Daniel Ceccaldi, Evelyne Buyle, Roger Carel, Raymond Armontel, Bernard Lecoq, Claude Dauphin.

results.title: Messages: Yellow ball workshop
results.brief_description: A series of advice films for children. Three on diet; good food for energy, beauty and to prevent overweight. One on the dangers of listening to clever advertising and one on the possible embarrassment of not reading the label correctly.

results.title: Devil's Marbles and the Olgas
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
The film provides a geological background to residuals in an arid landscape. It shows the influence of jointing and physical and chemical weathering on rocks. Particularly stressed are spheroidal weathering, freeze-thaw, coalescing alluvial fans and the influence of vegetation on rocks.

results.title: Ayers Rock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions. Illustrates examples of weathering and erosion responsible for producing the features seen in Ayers Rock. Shows three types of residuals found in arid Central Australia, kinds of weathering responsible for the formation of Ayers Rock and emphasises geological time periods. Also notes in detail the caves, grooves and guttering, and the under-cut base caused by running water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mesas and gibber plains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of some Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions, and discusses the formation of mesas and gibber plains. Animated diagrams illustrate formations. The importance of water erosion in arid regions is stressed.

results.title: Merseyside
results.brief_description: A survey of the Mersey River, one of the main arterials of Britain’s commerce from its soucre in the Derbyshire hills to its estuary below the port of Liverppol. As the river enters the sea, it is lined with docks, shipyards, and warehouses, which serve the continuous traffic on the Mersey River.
